intro: Clibadium sylvestre, commonly known as wild sumpweed, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and yellow flowers. The plant is often found in wetland environments, thriving in moist soils. Its seeds are small and oval, with a hard outer coating. Clibadium sylvestre has been used traditionally by indigenous peoples for food and medicinal purposes.
